definition: to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot

sentences.english: Kneeling is not fall, but may be trampled.
sentences.chinese: 跪着雖不會跌倒，但可能被踐踏。

sentences.english: Being a good friend does not mean being a doormat.
sentences.chinese: 成爲別人的好朋友並不等於可以任人踐踏。

sentences.english: That wreath, the pride of Ephraim 's drunkards, will be trampled underfoot.
sentences.chinese: 以法蓮的醉漢所戴的高傲冠冕，必被踐踏在腳下。

sentences.english: Indeed, it's often lumped into Beijing's long list of human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 的確如此，這經常集中於中國政府對人權的踐踏。

sentences.english: Her matronly fame was trodden under all men's feet.
sentences.chinese: 她那主婦的聲名任憑所有的人踐踏在腳下。

sentences.english: pigs being trampled by one another while being unloaded from a truck by a worker with a paddle;
sentences.chinese: 豬從卡車上卸下時，被工人使用棍棒驅趕而相互踐踏。

sentences.english: At the same time parents are undermining the authority of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 同時，父母們卻在踐踏着教師們的權威。

sentences.english: Trampling a ground every varieties grinds to test a training information.
sentences.chinese: 踐踏一地的各類研考培訓信息。

sentences.english: His father had just been trampled under foot and stamped upon in his presence, but by whom?
sentences.chinese: 他的父親剛纔被別人當着他的面踐踏了一陣，被誰？

sentences.english: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet. -- Mohandas K. Gandhi (1869-1948)
sentences.chinese: 我不會讓那些人骯髒的腳踐踏我的思想。
保護草坪免於行人踐踏？

sentences.english: I hate my self-esteem you have been trampled underfoot.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭我的自尊被你們踐踏在腳下。

sentences.english: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread .
sentences.chinese: 天使不敢踐踏的地方，蠢材蜂湧而至。

sentences.english: Once in power, they are ruthless in suppressing the rights of others.
sentences.chinese: 一旦其大權在握，就會無情踐踏他人的權利。

sentences.english: Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 耶路撒冷要被外邦人踐踏，直到外邦人的日期滿了。

sentences.english: The human footprint has stomped all over Mother Earth.
sentences.chinese: 人類已經完全踐踏了地球母親。

definition: to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
